executive_summary: Sanket Gaikwad is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) diagnosed in 2022. His current HbA1c is 8.4%, indicating a need for improved glycemic control, and he has elevated LDL levels, necessitating lifestyle modifications and potential medication adjustments.

clinical_context.recent_events: Two severe hypoglycemic episodes in the last 90 days

labs_table.comment: Above target, indicating poor glycemic control.
Fasting plasma glucose is within normal range.
Creatinine levels are within normal range.
HDL cholesterol is within normal range.

interpretation.assessment: Current HbA1c is above the target for T1DM, indicating a need for better diabetes management.
interpretation.plan: Consider insulin regimen adjustments and patient education on carbohydrate counting.

interpretation.assessment: LDL and triglycerides are above recommended targets, increasing cardiovascular risk.
interpretation.plan: Implement dietary changes and consider statin therapy.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Limit alcohol intake to no more than 14 units per week.

diet_plan.principles: Focus on a balanced diet rich in whole grains, lean proteins, fruits, and vegetables while reducing saturated fats and sugars.
sample_meals: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens and vinaigrette
Oatmeal topped with berries and a sprinkle of nuts
Baked salmon with quinoa and steamed broccoli
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use portion control methods such as measuring cups or a food scale to manage carbohydrate intake.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels between 4-7 mmol/L and post-meal levels below 8.5 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia and maintain a log of blood glucose readings.

patient_goals: Achieve HbA1c < 7.0% within the next 6 months.
Reduce LDL cholesterol to < 2.0 mmol/L within the next 6 months.
Increase physical activity to moderate levels within 3 months.

medication_plan.text: Consider starting a statin for dyslipidemia management.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c, lipid profile, and review lifestyle changes.

emr_note: Patient with T1DM, HbA1c 8.4%, elevated LDL and triglycerides. Recommended lifestyle modifications and consider statin therapy. Follow-up in 3 months.
